reporting-org.narrative: Norad - Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation

title.narrative: Hfu UNDOALOS assistance to meet the strategic capacity needs of developing states in ocean governance and the law of the sea

description.narrative: PROGRAMES OF ASSISTANCE TO MEET THE STRATEGIC CAPACITY NEEDS OF DEVELOPING STATES IN THE FIELD OF OCEAN GOVERNANCE AND THE LAW OF THE SEA. The project will entail the development and delivery of a variety of customized and needs-based capacity-building programmes for OECD-DAC countries, primarily the delivery of regional or national training workshops on the implementation of the UNCLOS framework, the 2030 Agenda and its SDGs, ocean-based economies ( blue economy ), as well as the conduct of gap analyses of legal frameworks for ocean governance at the national level. Other activities may include, as determined in consultations with Norad, and subject to resources, developing new and/or supplementing existing online courses on ocean governance and the UNCLOS framework. The target group will include mid-level Government officials and other ocean professionals from OECD-DAC States who are filling relevant key positions, including those charged with undertaking activities towards the implementation of UNCLOS and related agreements, in particular UNFSA, the 2030 Agenda and SDGs as they relate to oceans, and the development of ocean-based economies. Certain technical profiles will be required for participants to benefit from specific training, for example with respect to the delineation of the extended continental shelf, and for some project activities, the participation of relevant stakeholders from both governmental and non-governmental sectors may be beneficial.
